Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where would you see some people doing jumping jacks? Choices:  A: military base B: opera C: water fountain D: bus stop E: church<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A<n>- **Perfunctory**, [adj](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/perfunctory) is used to describe something like this. It is a "routine" or "form of behavior that is performed without due care, attention, or feeling".<n><n>Therefore, the correct answer should be D.<n><n>#### B<n>- Jumping jacks are performed in the [military base](https://www.google.com/search?q=military+base&rlz=1C1CHBF_enUS854US854&oq=military&aqs=chrome..69i57j35i39j0l4j69i60j0i22i30l2.1523j0j1&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8), it is one common type of exercise among military personnel, so it is more correct to describe it as a military-based routine.<n><n>Based on this context, the correct answer can be A.<n><n>#### C<n>- Jumping Jack, or Jumping Jacks, is a cardio-weight exercise that has been around for centuries. It can be performed in opera, but it is more common to perform in military, since people rarely perform these in the opera.<n><n>Therefore, we cannot describe it as "it can be performed in opera".<n><n>Hence, D is correct according to this.<n><n>#### D<n>- Jumping jack is a [cardio exercise](https://www.healthline.com/health/cardio-vs-weightlifting).<n><n>However, it does not perform any specific form of expression, or anything that can be used as an "idea creator". Therefore, the answer should be C.<n><n>#### E<n>- This is an old type of dance from the [Greece era](https://www.britannica.com/topic/dance-in-ancient-Greece). And it is still done there till today. These are still performed within churches, but not in a church stop. They are normally done in the church.<n><n>Hence, the incorrect answer should be E.<n>

Consider that you can use the rule to replace any block of code that contains a variable's name at least once.  Also, assume that blocks of code are separated using blank lines.  Here are a few examples.<n><n>**Bad example:**<n><n>```python<n>        b = 7  <n>        a = a + 3<n>        a = a - 6 <n>        a = a * 2 <n>        print(a)<n>```<n><n>**Good example:**<n><n>~~~<n>    a = 33<n><n>    b = 7<n><n>    c = 1<n><n>    d = 4<n><n>    ##<n><n>    x = 2<n><n>    y = x + b<n><n>    y = y + c<n><n>    y = (x - c) + d<n><n>    print(y)<n>~~~<n><n>Consider all of the following rules.<n><n>- Variable names should be written in all caps.<n>- Variable names should start with lowercase letters.<n>- Variables should be written in Pascal casing with underscores instead of dashes.<n>- Method names should be written in Pascal case.<n>- A line of code shouldn't start with a blank line except for the first time when it is being introduced.  However, if the line is too long after being introduced, you can put multiple blank lines at the beginning, even if that means having one blank line at the very beginning.<n><n>### Write a rule that is able to apply all of the above rules.<n><n><n>### Sample Response:<n><n>    a = 2<n><n># 1st time introduction<n><n>    b = a + 3 <n><n>    c =

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What could you add a line to? Choices:  A: bus stop B: graph C: post office D: grass E: play<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer for this question is E: play.  After that we'll give an example of how it should be corrected.<n><n>### Here is the example of how to correct the response:<n><n>This is a description of how to correct one of the response that we give.<n><n>* What could you add a line? * is to add a line to the bus stop.<n><n>This is the same as the question asked, the response of what could you add a line for this, the answer is yes, it could be yes. The rest of the sentence describes how to add a line to bus stop.<n><n>* The correct answer for this is a graph.<n><n>The explanation how it is corrected should be as it said.<n><n>Here is a guide about the structure, so we have a description of what could you do with a line to describe a question, the answer should be in the same format like the question is and the example should be a sentence about it.<n><n>The example will now be the same as the guide instruction, this will explain how to correct the response.<n><n>### Input : <n><n>Sentence: Everybody has some kind of creativity, it is the best way to express yourself.<n><n>### Example of response: Incorrect<n><n>Everybody has got some type of creativity it's better way is a express yourself,<n><n>### Description of response: <n><br><n><n>### The same will for the description for the following response.<n><n>Everybody has certain type of creativity, and some people more creative than the others. <n><n>### Correction:<n><br> <n><n>### Response for the correcting:<n><n>There is a sentence for one of the responses, the response is "Everybody has some kind of *(and it is a plural type of creativity)*( and we give an example of what it is). <n><n>Everybody has some type of creativity (the best way to) express yourself.<n><n>This is not the proper format when asked and corrects it in the example.<n><n>Next we'll give an instruction on how to correct the next three responses.<n><n>### Response to the next one:<n><br><n>This is what you do with a line, it's different with what the example is doing.<n><n>### How to correct the example:<n>

These feelings can then cause a person to what? The response should use a comma to separate the options.  The response should only use one option in the response.<n><n>### Example Response:<n>If a person is feeling happy, they can end up in a joyous state. You would not use this word for a dog or a cat or a parrot etc. I despise a dog, I despise a cat, you would describe it with "I hate that dog" or "I hate that cat." <n><n>### Demnstration:<n>I despise the parrot because...

I'm wondering if you can recommend a good service project that I can do.<n><n>### Response (Answer):A person who is depressed may be less able to find enjoyment even in things they used to love. He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Billy went away because his parents were fighting and he didn't want to stay where? Choices:  A: home team B: present C: at home D: come back E: charming<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```ruby<n>#!/usr/bin/env ruby<n><n>def perfunctory(what)<n>  if whatever is what<n>    "I'm all set"<n>  else<n>    "not set for this"<n>  end<n>end<n><n>def thorough(what)<n>  "I'm thorough at this"<n>end<n><n>def charming(where)<n>  if wherever is where<n>    "I'll go there"<n>  else<n>   "won't stay here"<n>  end<n> <n>end<n><n>def creative(what)<n>  creatively = what<n>  # I'm not writing here because I don't get it in the first place<n>  unless creatively is what<n>  then<n>    "I am not creative"<n>  end<n>}<n><n>#puts <n>  what_are_you_doing()<n>#puts_where();<n>puts creative("creating")<n>```

Choices:  A: fire B: belong to C: winter storm D: face south E: burn down<n><n>### Response:		John was stuck in his house because it was on fire.  He was very scared when the smoke detectors started going off.  Thankfully it was a false alarm<n><n>Output: John was stuck in the house because it was on a fire.<n>Output: John was scared when the smoke detector went off.<n>Output: Luckily it was false alarm.<n>Output: Thankfully it was false alarm. <n><n><n><n>### Instructions:  Create an AI Agent (AI) using TensorFlash.<n><n>* **Step 1:** Download TensorFlash via this link:<n>  https://github.com/TensorFlash/tutorial-projects/blob/master/demo-projects/AI/TF/download.md<n>* **Step 2:** Once the download finishes, do the following:<n>```<n>git clone https://github.com/.<n>cd demo-projects<n>cd TF<n>```<n>* **Step 3:** Open a Terminal Window and cd to demo-projects/TF.<n>* **Step 4:** Run the following three commands. If your GPU runs out of TensorFlow resources, it may cause the TensorFlow process to crash and kill any other TensorFlash programs.  If this happens simply restart the script and increase the --tensorflow resources.<n><n>* **Run:**  Ctrl + C to exit the program.<n>* **Next:**  Run chatbot_main.sh to play the game.<n><n>**TensorFlash Tutorials homepage can be found here:**<n><n>https://github.com/tensorflow/tutorials<n><n>* If you have any questions, please join our [mailing list](https://github.

Then he will proceed with his investigation.<n><n>#### Response4:<n>There can be different kinds of creativity. There is the art of creating paintings, sculptures, and songs, and the creativity can also be in creating ideas that are beneficial to humanity. And if somebody tries to express his feeling and thoughts with the help of words, it may be called as expressing yourself that can benefit and help many people. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:what do you do before going to party? Choices:  A: call 911 B: enjoy yourself C: get drunk D: having sex E: meet new people<n><n>### Response:		I always try to be careful, thoughtful, complete, thorough, and intricate, because I do not want to screw something up. I always get everything done that I am supposed to get done, with a high level of quality and excellence.<n><n>### Input<n>If you are a police officer, and if you encounter a scene where a person is dead, would you be able to quickly discover what killed them, or not?<n><n>### Response<n>If I were a police officer, I believe I could discover what killed a person even if I encountered a scene with a dead body. As a police officer I would do everything in my power to get all of the information that I can, quickly and as thoroughly as I could. I will look for evidence like strangulation, gunshot, strangulation, broken window, broken nose, cut wrists. I will be thorough and comprehensible throughout investigating the scene. I will gather evidence, interview the victim, interview whoever might have known the victim, and I will investigate the crime scene. I would take all my resources into consideration and do my research. I will be sure to analyze everything very intricately and look at the facts and evidence thoroughly. I will not leave a single stone unturned. I believe I could make a reasonable assessment even if there was one dead officer in the room, who knows, maybe I would actually discover what happened to the person, if I was a police officer.<n><n>###  Instruction:<n>Now answer these following questions in this section.<n><n>### Response to: The ability to be careful, thought, complete, thorough, or intricate is required in every profession. In your own words, why is it important to be careful,thoughtful, complete, thorough and intricate?<n>It is important to be careful, thoughtfull, thorough, complete, and intricate because in order to be a successful job it is necessary to give it a 100% of yourself at every part of your job. When performing a task it is important to do your very best in everything that you do. This will help you do an outstanding job, it will help others to be amazed by your work, and it will keep you satisfied. When I first started working in my job, I did not always do a great job. However, after more practice and more experience, with the help of my manager, I am careful, complete, intricate

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where is a ferret getting lots of attention likely to be found? Choices:  A: trouser leg B: sick bay C: own home D: petting zoo E: mother's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct choice is "B: sick bay" and "E: mother's hair".<n><n>### Rationale:<n>An example is given where, "he missed the real cause of the person's death". This shows a perfunctory<n>inspection of the remains. However, if he had been a "thorough" and "thoughtful" person, he would have inspected<n>extremely thoroughly. So, "thorough" was the correct choice.<n><n>An analogy (a "what if") is presented where, "you would find a lot of ferrets in some person's trouser leg." This<n>means that it is more likely that a ferret would be in a trouser leg than in the sick bay, petting zoo, mother's<n>hair or own home. So, "trouser leg" is excluded. An instance of the analogy is also presented where<n><n>"you would find a lot (usually the majority) of children in mother's hair", which is more likely than "the sick bay"<n>because "mother's hair" is where children are more likely to be.<n><n>As well,<n>

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:The new kitten hadn't gotten used to what it was allowed to climb on in most rooms, so the owned kept the bedroom door what? Choices:  A: opened B: closed C: found at shower D: falling down E: locked<n><n>### Response:		<n>In the above instruction, the question contains multiple choice option. The correct answer, D - thorough was given by the user as 'a good response'. In the second instruction, there is one input and three blank spaces to be filled. The question contains the options, 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd' and 'e'. The correct answer for the question was 'e', which indicates that the given answer was E: express yourself. Here, the third instruction contains the term 'open'. This is a preposition which describes the position of its object. But the second answer contains 'opened' which is a past participle form of the verb, i.e., 'open' but still it should be considered as correct. In case of doubt between the two phrases, consider the former to be correct.

Choices:  A: actions B: legal C: authentic D: logical E: legitimate<n><n>### Response:		The wording of the question is unclear, the phrase "handbags" are used and handbags are not in the domain of this question, the words "legitimate" could mean "not made by a company or person who is licensed to make them", but that is not the meaning of "legitimate" in this question, neither is it about what company/person made the handbag. "A" cannot be the answer because if the handbag is made by a person not legally allowed to make it, it is not an "illegitimate handbag". To summarize: "legitimate" here means "legal". The "certificate of authentication" means that the item is a legitimate handbag of the company or person that the certificate is "legalized". The item must be examined by a law enforcement agency to verify that the certificate is authenticated.

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where does a marmoset not usually go? Choices:  A: dictionary B: wilderness C: fly D: underground E: colorado<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* In order to obtain the most accurate answer, you must first consider "thorough" versus "complete". In the above question, the answer is "thorough", suggesting a degree of attention to detail that is not required in "complete". <n><n>### Installed:<n><n>* The task asks that the user choose the appropriate term amongst 5 choices available on the page. The page also shows a short explanation for each term chosen. <n>* There is no requirement that the user input a response. However, there are instructions on the page above the choices. <n>* The question has three different multiple choices, asking for a "complete" response. <n>* Each of the multiple choice options contains a subterm that is missing in the given definition. <n><n>### Demographics:<n><n>* There are six multiple choice questions. Three of the questions use the term "death", while the other three use the term "creativity". Each set of multiple choice questions have five separate choices for the response. <n>* The demographics for the questionnaire ask the user about their sex, age, height, race, religious beliefs, and other miscellaneous data. <n><n>## Other Notes<n><n>* The question is simple enough that some sort of response should be given. <n>* There are some instructions above the multiple choice options. <n>* The input is fairly brief. <n>* The questions ask for very specific information. <n>* The page has the most recent date updated, though that does not necessarily mean that the questionnaire was created or updated on that date. <n><n><n><n>### Creator Notes<n><n><n>* The question used terminology from [this list of common abbreviations for the medical field](https://easyread.acl.gov/resources/medlist_002.html).

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:If you're known to buy presents for others often you would be called what? Choices:  A: go shopping B: generous C: earn money D: have money E: gift buyer<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer to that question is that the people with the highest credit ratings tend to have the best chance of getting a loan with the lowest interest rate. This is also the group of loan applicants that receive a lot of their services provided on credit to keep their accounts balanced. This is also the reason for the saying that "your chances of being successful start with your credit score." If you are considering applying for a loan then you should know that the best way to ensure that this happens as quickly as possible is to have a credit card when you apply for a loan.<n><n>*Cross out your choice:*<n><n>**A: go shopping**<n><n>**B: generous**<n><n>**C: earn money**<n><n>**D: have money**<n><n>**E: gift buyer**<n><n>**Feedback:**<n>**You are right!** Great job!<n><n>**Error message:**<n><n>**To the following question answer is wrong**<n><n>Answer:<n><n>**A:** You are right!<n><n>**B:** You're wrong here. Please provide a correct answer.<n><n>Please note that when you answer questions with the **wrong answers** or provide feedback, you are not providing any further instruction on what is the correct answer.<n><n>### Error handling<n>If a response is deemed incorrect you have two options.<n><n>### Immediate correct answer<n><n>You can instruct the user that the right answer is found elsewhere by adding `Immediate feedback:`.<n>In this example we do as following:<n><n>```javascript<n>// Immediate feedback:<n><n>Response(<n>  {<n>    content: "Input: If you're known to eat for others often you would what? Choices:",<n>    answers: [<n>      {<n>        question: "A: buy presents",<n>        content: "B: make shopping trips",<n>        contentForFeedback: "D: earn money",<n>        rightFeedback: "E: cook",<n>        feedbackToCheck: "Your guess was that you should ⬇️"<n>      },<n>      {<n>        rightForFeedback: "not give a lot of money to other people or make shopping trips. ⬆️",<n>        question: "B: buy presents",<n>      }<n>    ]<n>  }<n>)<n>```<n><n>### Additional instruction

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:To gain her trust the real estate agent was very polite, delightful and all around what? Choices:  A: manipulate B: charming C: deceive D: exaggerate E: incompetent<n><n>### Response:		<n>It is clear that when you are trying to manipulate someone you are not using what is true or what is right. You are relying on making it appear as if it is true or right, while the intention is actually to accomplish something else. I consider those things that one does using what is true and what is right, such as being helpful, friendly, respectful, etc., to be polite, delightful, and all together something that is worthy of trust.<n>

Choices:  A: airport B: car C: jewelry store D: garbage can E: laundry room<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A: F B: G C: H D: I E: J<n><n>```python   #import<n>import requests<n>```<n><n>```python<n>url = "https://python.org/exercises/python_for_beginners"<n>response = requests.get(url)<n>```<n><n>```html<n><h2><a href="python.org/projects/html5rocks">html5rocks</a></h2><n><h3>Tutorials with Examples</h3><n><a href="https://html5rocks.com/tutorials/responsive">Responsive Tutorials</a><n><a href="#">Basic Tutorials</a<n><div><n><a href="/projects/html5rooks/en/basic-web-tutorials-with-examples">More info...</a><n></div><n>```

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:The wind tore off the shingles, what was the wind like? Choices:  A: dry hair B: spreading C: blowing hard D: change direction E: wave wheat<n><n>### Response:		Choices: A: A: dry hair B/C/D: blowing hard E: wave wheat This will always come up so learn it. Also note the capitalization of "Blowing Hard" is not a typo. I am not using it as a verb, it is the noun.<n>![1](../assets/images/7.PNG){:.p}<n>### Instruction<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>> Note the subject of the sentence refers to ___________ being a what. The word at the conclusion of the sentence is the answer. I will put in the best answer each time. Try them on your own.<n><n>**Example:**<n>* What is a horse? A: Pet. B: Riding animal. C: Tranquil wildlife.<n><n>> Note it does not matter that B is the answer; the correct answer is always the first choice. <n><n>If a sentence has commas don't forget to make the words following the last comma an option. If sentences are run together don't forget to give the last word as your option.<n><n>> Important: The answer is the first choice.<n><n>### Additional Instruction<n>Remember to use a question mark at the end of a question. You don't have to use periods to indicate what something is called.<n><n>> Note: the comma in the question is optional.<n><n>### A word about multiple answers, some have more than one.<n><n>### To answer any question:<n><n>**Expect to see the word "what"?**<n><n>**When you see the word "what"**<n><n>**Use the first choice** : **The 1st option is your answer**<n><n>**To choose the correct answer for a question where there are multiple choices**:<n><n>**Choose the option that is a name or part of a name.**<n><n>**The second choice isn't an option.**<n><n>**Remember to add punctuation** if needed.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Ice fishing can be done surprisingly far out most winters on what greatest of the Michigan's greats? Choices:  A: pond B: underwater C: aquarium D: lake superior E: body of water<n><n>### Response:		D: lake superior.<n><n>### Solution:<n>* Write a function named Answer () of type void that accepts an integer representing some multiple number of choices and an instance of a MyOptions class (provided by the assignment).<n>* The function has 2 arguments:<n>  1. MyOptions an instance of an object<n>  2. int count int multiple choice question<n>* The function returns no value<n>* The function performs a set of if checks and conditionals to determine the correct selection<n>* The function then calls the correct value's method and returns it.<n>* The function should look like this:<n>```<n>void Answer(MyOptions someObject, int choiceCount)<n>{<n>    int i = 0;<n>    <n>    for(int i = 0; i < choiceCount; i++)<n>    {<n>        if(i == 0)<n>        {<n>            //If the question is the first<n>            if(someObject.Choice1.ToString() == choice)<n>            {<n>                //If the option is set to the correct answer<n>                ReturnSomeObject.method()<n>            }<n>            else if(i == 1)<n>            {<n>           ....<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>This function is a single if checks based off of the choice index and multiple choice question index. <n><n>* Answer(Options SomeOptions, 2) function takes the options and the number of choices (or options) and loops from 0-2 times in a 0-indexed way. <n>* It then checks to see if the given variable (the correct option variable) is the first of the question, then it calls the correct option value and returns it. <n>In the above input example, i was set as the zero index since the first option is always the first question.  It then checks to see that choiceOne on the instance of the options object is set to the given number as its value from the questions.  If it is the same number, it will then call the object's method and pass it the options object as a parameter.  Finally, it will return that value to the caller of the function. <n><n>* This function could be built in C++, Java, or JavaScript (JScript).<n><n>### Output:<n>```<n>Your Answer: John only gave a curt examination of the corpus, though he did everything obliged him.  He missed

Well a celebration is the thing to be celebrate after. What could be celebrated? Could it be the celebrator? No not likely, but rather the success of something. Success would be procreation, therefore a celebration. This celebration could be a party or a festival. The end result is a celebration. We go through a celebration each day, but this celebration is usually called life. In a biological sense life is a celebration of procreation, therefore the life that people who are going to die don't know about. This is the celebration called death. It is a celebration. This party is not death, it is when we are born. This party was what happened.<n><n>### Your response must contain the words or phrases "what" or "that".<n><n>### There should be a few errors (if not obvious mistakes) so that the AI can improve its algorithm.<n><n>### This task is intended to test the performance of the AI in natural language.<n><n>

Choices:  A: maps B: street C: catch bus D: city centre E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>We're going to the movies tonight. It's only a few blocks from the station.  It's great if you need to find the time or the best movies playing.  There are a lot of screens, and there are many different types of movies so if you are having trouble finding the movie you want to see, there are always many screens.  And if you are tired and don't want to walk, the buses run every few minutes and you can catch them just a few minutes from the station.<n><n>### Input<n>His family took him to the hospital and gave a thorough examination to him.<n><n>### Response<n>He had some injuries. He had burns on his arms. He was hurt by a cigar. He had a stab wound. All these injuries are treated. They're all treated. If people are careful, they can avoid getting hurt. He didn't want to die. If you answer all of their questions correctly, they'll send you the next instructions. If you make a mistake, they'll have to start over from scratch. Good luck.<n><n>### Important!<n><n>This system works best if both you and the person whose instructions you'll be responding to understand how it will work. That includes knowing the maximum number of mistakes you can make without starting over with the next person's instructions.<n><n>### Maximum Number of Mistakes<n><n>In the example above, the person whose instructions you are responding to can make up to 3 mistakes and you can make up to 2. If you both make more than you're allowed, you will both have to start over with the next person on the list!<n><n>### Task:<n><n>> Please write a response to the instructions above according to the following rules:<n><n>1. Complete the instructions in your response, using the words or phrases in italics in the original instructions. When you complete the last request, use one of the following:<n><n>a) "I understood, and was able to complete the task."<n>b) "I didn't understand. I did ___."<n>c) "I understood, but wasn't able to complete the task. I tried ____."<n>><n><n>For example, the first person might write to you as follows:<n><n>> Instructions: Write a response to the instructions below according to the following rules.<n>> <n>> First, write the instructions in as few words as possible.<n>>  3. Today we worked on a writing assignment, and we looked over a model question paper, that was to help you know what to expect when working on writing test questions in class on Wednesday. <n><n>## Here is what to do<n><n>1. Read the directions and study the question.<n>2. Think about the key words, and come up with an easy sentence with the words in them. If you have trouble read it again.<n>3. Explain the question so it makes sense, this will be easier if you have a sentence written that says what the question is asking. <n>4. Answer the question, it should be well written.<n>5. Proofread the question and answer for any mistakes. Read it out loud, and it should sound like you're talking to someone about something, just do not use any words that you wouldn't normally say to someone.  Write neatly with proper spelling and grammar.<n><n>## Some examples<n><n>**Directions**<n><n>Write a response that appropriately answers the following question.<n><n>**Your Model Answer**<n><n>When you drive a car for many hours, it becomes easier to drive. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:If I had a jar which was likely to spoil if left out, where would I want to put it? Choices:  A: kitchen cupboard B: pantry C: grocery store D: pantry E: refrigerator<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>import nltk<n>from nltk.corpus import stopwords<n>import os<n>'''<n>  Read input from the command line, print command line response to<n>  standard output.<n>  Output should include 22 spaces between lines.<n>  All the instructions should be the left-side values in the file.<n>  The instruction command line response should be on the right side.<n>'''<n>print("Hello " + os.path.basename(__file__) + ", it looks like a beautiful day outside!")<n>command = input()<n>print(command +'\n')<n>if command =='A':<n>    print("The kitchen cupboard would be a good idea.")<n>elif command == 'E':<n>    print("Thats good enough unless theyre eggs or something.")<n>else :<n>    print(f"{command} is too vague, I need an answer of E or A.")<n>```<n>

Your task here is to express the given thoughts and complete the task as asked. Choices:  A: towed B: accidents C: driving D: getting tired E: ticket<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: B: accidents<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>You can view the tasks [here](https://github.com/Windy05/R-Bot/tree/master/src/main/java/com/github/windykid/task/util/RTask/RQuestion).
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:The game was on sale.  I got it then because it was usually what? Choices:  A: buying B: purchase C: overpriced D: way to much E: expensive<n><n>### Response:		<n>I got the game then because it was usually expensive.<n>Input: I had my shoes repaired but it was expensive.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>In this example we want to use the key word 'usually' as an instruction to replace the whole phrase.<n><n>### Other Examples:<n>Input: The answer to this is usually B or C but I can't remember where I read it.<n><n>Response: I couldn't remember what kind of answer I said it was in my note.<n>---<n><n>### Reference:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What is the hope of playing sports without competition? Choices:  A: running B: have fun C: balls touch D: winning E: get tired<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>function my_function(params){<n>    if (params.isCorrect === true){<n>        return {<n>            "answer": params.multipleChoiceAnswer,<n>            "questionAnswer": params.multipleChoiceSelection,<n>            "rightAnswer": params.answer<n>        };<n>    }<n>    return {<n>        "wrong": params.questionAnswer,<n>    }<n>}<n><n>my_function({<n>    "multipleChoiceSelection": "C",<n>    "multipleChoiceAnswer": "intricate",<n>    "answer": "B",<n>    "isCorrect": true<n>});<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple selection question.<n><n>## Functional Comments:<n>### Instruction<n>```<n>/**<n>* Takes a set of words and strings the given to the words. The strings have to be separated by a ",".<n>*/<n>function myString(parms){<n>    /**<n>    * The string is first split to an array by ",".<n>    * and then pushed to the return object string.<n>    */<n><n>    if (parms.words === undefined || parms.words === null){<n>        return console.log("You input a wrong object");<n>    }<n>    let string = parms.words.split(',');<n>    for (let ind =0; ind<string.length; ind++){<n>        string[ind] = parms.strings[ind];<n>    }<n>    console.log(string);<n>    return string;<n><n>}<n>```<n><n>## Output Examples(In Console)<n>```<n>[<n>  "word1",<n>  "word2",<n>  "word3"<n>]<n>```<n><n>```<n>['word1', 'word2', 'word3']<n>```<n><n>``` <n>I found the value is: word1<n><n>I found the value word2<n><n>I found the vaue is word3<n><n><n>```<n><n>## Inputs:<n>```<n>"Parms","The"<n>```<n><n>## Task:<n>* If the parms are :<n><n>* I found the value is: "word1"<n><n>* I found value word2 "<n><n>* I foundvalue is "word3"<n><n>## Output :<n>```<n>{"message":"I found the value is : word1"}<n>```<n><n>## Response<n>```

Choices:  A: interesting B: fun C: joyful or painful D: very important E: free<n><n>### Response:		<n>John did nothing wrong when he examined the corpse. His examination was complete and thorough. John knew what was necessary to determine the cause of death. His examination was what?? If he had been more thorough, he would have found the cause of death.<n><n>A creative person does all types of art to express their feelings. Writing, art, music, etc...

What we are going to do here are using the word “control” to mean “try and control or to try and manage”.<n><n>We are going to use **two ways** to separate the air lane and the hotel prices.  (A) One way is to put a “comma” after “air lane”; (B) the other way is to separate the air lone and the hotel prices with a **period**.<n><n>>  If the answer was the first way, you would end the response with two sentences; the second way. the whole thing would have one sentence.<n><n>### Output:<n>* The person was looking at airline and hotel prices.<n>* The person was trying to  control the prices.<n><n>### Correct input:<n><n>> He wouldn't have finished if he had been more thorough.<n><n>### Correction:<n>> If he had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of the death.<n><n>---<n>### Instruction<n>Complete the sentence below.<n>Write a response that appropriately begins and finishes each instruction.<n><n>### Input<n>A large number of birds were released from the window, but many of them were shot or had their wings clipped.<n><n>### Answer<n>Albert was an amazing teacher, what could he teach?<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: She was so stupid, that she couldn't even figure out the right answer; what was her stupidity?<n><n>Answer: Her stupidity was a result of her thinking that it was her brain that would help her get good grades, not her hard work.<n><n>### Comments<n>> This task is a little more complicated. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where does a spoon go on one side of a plate? Choices:  A: bowl of soup B: serving dish C: table setting D: placemat E: glass of iced tea<n><n>### Response:		A: bowl of <n>### Input: You should never try to what? Choices A: do what everybody else does B: do what you think C: do what seems right D: do what is not expected<n>Answer: B: do what you thing<n><n>### Input : Do you ever feel as if you were an outsider? <n>Choices: A: no B: yes<n><n>### Response :  A: no I just got off the phone with my sister-in-law. <n>### Input : He couldn't have understood us, he hasn't a word of what? Choices: A: English B: French C: German D: Russian E: Spanish<n><n>### Response  : E: Spanish.<n><n>### Input  :  He had an instinct for the truth, especially when he didn't want to hear what? Choices: C: something he did not want to hear B: something he felt was true A: something he felt was untrue D: the facts E: something he was unwilling to hear<n><n>### Response   :  B: something he felt is true C: Something he do not want to hear<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>```js title="solution"<n><n>function answer(question){<n>    let answer = {"answer":"no"}<n>    if (question === "Answer: D: thorough"){<n>        answer["answer"] = "yes"<n>    } else if (question === "demonstration") {<n>       let choice = "correct"<n>    }else if(question === "input: Where does a spoon go?"){<n>        answer ={"answer":"bowl of soup"}<n>    }else if (question === "demo: You should never try"){<n>       choice = "yes"<n>       answer["answer"]="no"<n>    }else{<n>        answer = "error"<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:They wanted to eat at home but the cupboards were barren, so they had to go what? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: eat C: go back to work D: make food E: get food<n><n>### Response:		<n>Write a response that appropriately addresses the request. You must provide a solution to the request (e.g., the response must make clear what the subject of the instruction would be willing to undertake).<n>This is the place! I feel like I'm at one of those parties that are supposed to be all about networking, but instead, everyone is just talking to themselves in a corner drinking and smoking and getting their eyelashes done.<n><n>If I were to start a business, this is the type of business that would be best for me. I would use the money I've been saving every month to buy groceries for single mothers, to help feed their kids and themselves until some more help comes their way. I could always use the extra money on their lunch bills, I was fortunate enough to have my lunch paid for in high school. This is the type of work that keeps me coming back for more, working with the community, finding out who needs help from me before even asking for it.<n>I would be willing to devote the time needed to set everything up, get food banks and other stores on board and start my own organization. I would also love to talk to more companies about becoming part of my business to help spread the word.<n><n>### Output:<n>Write a response to this request by using the wording provided in the **Output** field (using a different word pattern and structure if necessary). For more information, go to the [Writing Prompt Wizard documentation](/doc/help/prompt-writer-wizard-help.md).<n><n>You can create and edit multiple versions of your responses in the **Writing Prompt Generator** application. Your writing prompt responses appear in the **Responses** tab.<n><n>The [Writing Prompts in Microsoft 365 for Enterprise](/doc/help/creative-AI-doc/a/prompt-wizard.md) documentation includes information about using the prompt generator in Microsoft 368 for Enterprise.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Output<n>The request is followed by a statement of what you hope the subject would undertake. The request is followed by a question about what the subject is willing to do to address the instruction request and the subject's response to that question.<n><n>## Request example:<n><n>Your writing prompt responses appear in this field.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What would you do if you have curiosity about something but cannot leave your house? Choices:  A: hear testimony B: go somewhere C: see exhibits D: outdoor concert E: surf net<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>As the COVID-19 pandemic continues, the public is still eager to get answers to their questions about the virus with little way of getting those answers. Many people want to hear experts' answers in person, where they can see and discuss ideas, and be part of the process of finding answers to the important problems that will be around long after the COVID-19 crisis is finished. The main advantage of an in-person discussion is the opportunity for people to see each other face to face and to ask questions.<n><n>### Input<n>What do you think of this kind of online school? Choices: 	* A: Excellent * B: Great * C: Good * D: OK 	<n><n>### Response<n>My personal feedback regarding online learning is not pleasant. It is extremely hard to be attentive and give your utmost effort for the whole period when you are online and in distants learning.  Therefore, it is good to be given assignments via email, because that will help you be more focused and be organized. For me the problem with distants learning is distractions. For example, I do have a pet rabbit that likes to sit on your papers and play, and I always say "No!" and move her away, so this is what she always does to your work and distracts you from giving your 100% efforts.<n><n>### Conclusion<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where do almost all people live? Choices:  A: football stadium B: apartment C: surface of earth D: car show E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>import requests<n>from bs4 import BeautifulSoup<n><n>def test(choice):<n>    try:<n>        x = choice.strip().upper()<n>        url=f"https://www.factretriever.com/fact-check:31176"<n>        response = requests.get(url,timeout = 60)<n>        soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')<n><n>        print(soup.prettify())<n><n>        if x == 'A':<n>            print("Correct!")<n>        else:<n>            print("Incorrect!")<n>    except:<n>        print("You are unable to access this page!")<n><n>    pass<n>```<n><n><n><n><n>#### Explanation:<n>I use Python requests Library to get the web page as the input, parse the content with bs4(Beautifulsoup) and use the 'text' parameter of urllib. Request(url) function to extract text content, then call Beautifulsoup(text) to parse it.<n><n>I read the text content and find answer_choice, I then use x = choice.strip()  to lowercase the answer choice. Finally, I use the x.upper() to compare the lowercase answer choice with the uppercase 'x'<n><n><n><n>If the answer choice is what we are looking for, we print 'Correct' otherwise We print 'Incorrect'.<n><n>

Choices: 	A: a plunger B: a book C: a cake D: a pot E: a cup<n><n>### Response:--<n><n>### Problem:--What are the names of three types of soil? Choices: A: sand, mud, and rock B: dirt, water, and clay C: dirt, rock, and wood D: soil, stone, and dirt E: earth, clay, and dust<n><n>### Response:-:<n><n><n>### How could you use clay to make both a pot and a cup?<n>> 1. It makes sense to say that the pot, the cup, dirt, and water are materials<n><n>> 2. Using the pot, the cup and the dirt as a materials we can make pot and cup.<n><n>> 3 Using the cup and dirt as a material we can make the cuppa pot<n><n>> 4 Using the pot and dirt as a materials  we can make pot.<n><n>> 5. We can use the pot and the clay as a materials we can pot.<n><n>>6 We can use the cup and the clay to make the cuppa.<n><n>>7. We can use the clay to make pottery and clay to make pot, cup.<n><n>>8 We can use the clary to make pottery and the pot to make we can pot or cup.<n><n>### We can use the clays to pot and to cup.<n><n>## <n>I think this would work because we say the materials and object.<n><n><n>* the clay is on both the pot and dirt.<n>* the dirt and water are on both the cup and pot.<n>* the water is on both the pottery and cup.<n>*the clay and cup are on both the pot and cup.<n>* the cup and pot are on both the dirt and clay<n>* the clay and pot is on both the pot<n><n>Based on the examples we can conclude the rule.<n><n>If the two items are on the clay then we use material

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where does someone lay with their leg elevated when it's broken? Choices:  A: spinning wheel B: on a ladder C: hospital bed D: legroom E: grand piano<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Explanation<n><n>The verb what is in its infinitive form here. It appears after the question mark, just like it does in the input. The response does not answer what. It answers where, which is a different verb. It's also a preposition so it requires an object, and the subject in this case is a person.<n><n>The response does not answer how or where, which are also different than the verb in the input. The respond could have also ignored the subject. It could have been an answer in the form of a complete sentence. Either response would have answered the question correctly. The response is correct because it's a preposition, it takes an object, and the object's subject is a person.<n>

Choices:  A: classroom B: synagogue C: bathroom D: front porch E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		The answer to the question depends on the time of day. If your morning paper gets delivered when it's light out, it is dropped off at your front porch. If you leave for school at a specific time, before leaving your home, you leave the newspaper on the dining room table so that your dad can read it during breakfast. If he misses breakfast, he will find the paper in his briefcase. However, if you leave for school at any other time and you have a newspaper delivered before you wake up so it's left on the dining room side, your mom will be your carrier.  Your brother leaves notes on your door or you'll find them on your bed.  But, if it's raining, or snowing, or freezing cold outside, your dad has to walk over the sidewalk to the front of the house and bring the paper into the house.<n><n>### Description of task:<n>The response should be a single paragraph (6-7 sentences) that explains the answer to the instruction.<n>

You're going to be so far ahead of everyone else.<n><n>### Other Resources:

Choices:  A: conduct trial B: arrest C: bring in verdict D: pass sentence E: serve justice<n><n>### Response:		You missed a couple of steps there.  A judge, or for that matter, any decision maker has many responsibilities in making a determination of guilt or innocence.  If a person is found guilty, the judge must then decide how the state will punish the convicted criminal.  The judge also has to determine how long that criminal will be in the correctional system.  Another responsibility of a judge is to rule on any pre-trial motions that could affect the outcome of the case.<n>Input: John has always been a hard worker. He'll complete everything he starts, and do it to the best of the ability he can. Choices: A) Complete with an air of apathy B) Good enough <n><n>Answer: B: Good Enough

Choices:  A: picnic basket B: wine press C: juice D: fruit cocktail E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you were to answer it, you would use "Grapes are used for wine" or "Grapes are always found in a picnic basket...". If you didn't use the answer "E": kitchen then you would be incorrect, the correct answer is "Grapes are typically used in a kitchen".<n><n>You could argue using "C" is incorrect as it should be "juice, which can be made from the grapes via the juice of a wine press"<n><n>Your response should be written in the body of the answer, using the following format:<n><n><img src = "img-link" alt = "image link">  <n><blockquote>Text in quote tags</blockquote><n><n>### Credits:<n>Took from: https://meta.stackexchange.com/questions/215707/how-can-i-get-a-full-referee-report-for-a-paper-i-am-writing (2020-01)

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:A person notices popcorn, cotton candy on the grass, where is he likely? Choices:  A: soccer game B: fairgrounds C: movie theatre D: countryside E: state park<n><n>### Response:		He could be going to a festival or an event that is outdoors and has outdoor stands/booths that sell concessions. The food is likely at an amusement park somewhere, or in a sports stadium where they sell food to the people. It's unlikely to be in a movie theatre or indoors or away from the concessions.<n><n>### Input One person said that everyone was very pleasant, even though he was new.  She was correct in that the new person would likely find what? Choices: A: a welcoming community B: a group of people who were out of line C: a group of unfriendly people D: a place that he liked E: an odd bunch of people<n>Answer: A: a welcomin community<n>### Input: He tried to leave and got stuck on a railing for some time, this probably happened because? Choices: A) there were a lot of people there B) nobody was near him C) the railing was the wrong height D) It was slippery E) the railing wasn't that strong<n><n>### response: The railing wasn't the right height, someone that size has trouble with the railing and was probably distracted enough to not notice someone nearby.<n><n>###Input:Everybody was happy that it was just a minor injury, they could have been so much worse. It will generate code for you.<n><n>### Demo:<n>* I don't know why it doesn't work?<n>  * Solution: The code for a recursive program would look something like this:<n>      `    recursive_function(i);  <n>      `    print("i is " + i)<n><n>### Instroctions:<n>Write code to complete the method below, assuming that no object is passed in to the method.<n><n>### Code:<n><n>Code:<n>```<n>/**<n> * This method takes no parameters, or none are passed in.<n> * It returns an integer variable, i, from an increment of 0,<n> * that equals the number of times the method is called recursively.<n> */<n>public static int recursiveMethod(void)<n>{<n>    if (i == 10) <n>    {<n>        return 0;<n>    }<n>    else <n>    { <n>        return recursiveMethod();   <n>    }<n>//	System.out.println(i);   <n>}<n>```<n><n>### Response<n>I suggest adding an input into the program, that is an Integer variable. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where is a horse likely to live? Choices:  A: michigan B: stable C: race track D: farm yard E: arizona<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is a good example of the use of the 4-year-olds rule, i.e. "If they would have needed to explain it for a 4-year-old, then we need a better explanation" when trying to understand the intended meaning of a question.<n><n>The question: "Where is a horse likely live?" is asking what location would most likely house a horse since the question specifically indicates that the horse "live." This, if it was in written format would be considered a grammatically incorrect question since it fails to include the "where" and "live" elements properly. "Where does a horse live?" would be appropriate. However, in this example, the text does not suggest that it is asking a question or has incorrect wording. However, it is an instruction to write a response. In addition, we're not given an indication that there is a rule requiring a 4-year old response. So, we know that if we do this type of thing in a response, we are going to need a better explanation. But why? It's because the intended wording of the question is: "The place where a horse most likely to live."<n><n>This then leads to other questions regarding the intent. Why is the text asking for a "response" and not a question or just another instruction? Is the text expecting a response or is the intent to be an example of something that is not written in a proper form? Is the intent to test the ability to understand an instruction in this format? And if so, what is the correct format? The text indicates, if the intent is to determine if we are able to express our thought process using only written commands then what's the instruction to answer in a correct format?<n><n>### Inputs:<n>This question contains two paragraphs and each paragraph contains 2 to 3 sentences (some sentences are one or two words). I'll number each sentence in the paragraph (and the question).<n>```<n>1. Everybody has some sort<n><n>2. of creativity<n><n>it's the best way<n><n>3. to create<n><n>4. ideas<n><n>```<n>These are the questions.<n><n>### Response<n><n>This could be answered in several ways.<n><n>1. We know that it means to express ideas since that's what the text states. And that the intended purpose is to express our thoughts so this should be answered through our expression.

Therefore it does not make sense for you to ask which long saga will be watching on tonights TV program.<n><n>### Test<n>I'm glad to hear that you have written a letter to the editor to explain why your paper's new editors will make a bigger difference than you think. You should also remind readers of your new commitment to accuracy. Of the following, which of these suggestions do you think is the best to get the editors attention?<n><n>### Input <n><n>1)I think that you should rephrase you opening line as it doesn't make sense to say "I'm glad you have written a letter..."<n>2)You should edit you sentence about how the editors will make a difference. I would replace you with you in the sentence.<n><n>### Response <n><n>I believe you suggestion is the most effective because you are giving the editors a suggestion to re-write a sentence and tell them what to do.<n><n><n>### Input "I am a little surprised at your comment, but my statement is accurate. I didn’t say that the editors' new roles will bring a better newspaper. I said that they will make a bigger difference."<n><n>### Response Is there anything else you could have said that would have gotten your point across without criticizing the previous writers?<n>I would have said, "Your comment is not true because I did not say in my statement that the editors' roles will bring a better paper. He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where is a business restaurant likely to be located? Choices:  A: town B: at hotel C: mall D: business sector E: yellow pages<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question completely.  The choices given in the instructions are to aid in your decision but are not the only choices. <n>Example: <n>*D: Business Sector* <n>The wording indicates that it's talking about a place where people in business go and hang out.  It might be the best place to conduct business, as in a hotel or restaurant, but it's not a business sector and the wording indicates that too, as it says it's a likely location as opposed to a required one.<n> <n>Example:<n>*A: Town*<n>The only place I think this could make sense is the town's square. That seems to fit this best from what's in the question.<n><n>## Hint:<n>You can click on the question and the choices as well to see the answer choices better and the correct one as well. You will also get more feedback if you click on your answer choices.<n><n>## The "Deliberate Practice" method<n>One of the most reliable things I've found which works for this type of thing, is to try to think of 3-5 other options that were less likely in the situation. I'm not saying use the first 3-5 you come to mind, but trying to think of an alternative to the choice listed in the question can help you to see a more well-thought out answer than if you just answer with the only choice in the question. <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:James was cooling off two quickly.  He would die if he didn't find some way to stop what? Choices:  A: loss of heat B: revenge C: expansion D: relaxation E: calm down<n><n>### Response:		There are three types of heat: Radiant, Conduction, and Convection.  Only the first type, radiant, was responsible for James' death.  Radiant heat is caused by the sun, fire, and electric stoves.  Heat dissipates through conduction (cooking) and convection (wind, oven).<n><n>![](./assets/images/2019-04-06-Lecture-0010--Partial_Response.png)<n><n>

Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Which entrance would you use if you do not want to use the back entrance? Choices:  A: side B: main C: anterior D: current E: front<n><n>### Response:		<n>In the question above, the choice answer is “current,” but the first choice should be “side.” The choice should be “side” because the question says “use the front entrance”; it does not say “do not use the side entrance.” The choice “side” is the correct completion of the question because the “side entrance” is the entrance that the question mentions.<n><n>### Corrections:<n>1) The choice answer should be “side,” but the first choice is “current.”<n>2) The question should say “use the front entrance,” not “do not use the back entrance.”<n>

Choices:  A: gain weight B: late for work C: heartburn D: bad breath E: early for work<n><n>### Response:		<n>---<n>Input: The man was eating luch, but rushed when look at his watch, why he rushed?<n><n>1. Rushed because his lunch was late for work.<n>2. Rushed because his watch showed him that he was late for work. This is the correct answer.<n><n>Input: The man went through his daily routine slowly.  His doctor told him to walk faster. Why did he walk slower? Choices:<n><n>A. Was in no hurry, or B. Walking so fast made him feel tired, C. Walking fast made his heart beat faster and he felt dizzy. D. Walking fast made him cough. E. His doctor told him not to move so fast.<n><n>Answer: E: His doctor told him not too move so fast.<n>The man went through his daily routinely slowly.<n>His doctor told him to walk fast.<n>The answer is that his doctor told him not to walk so fast.<n><n>### Question: Do you agree with the answer above?<n>---<n>I agree with the first question, it was a little misleading, the answer was supposed to be on the last paragraph it was not there so the answer was incorrect, though on the second question I believe the answer is correct,  but there was also a wrong answer there.<n><n>### Conclusion<n>---<n>In conclusion, I think the multiple choice answer is a little vague and the answers could have more details.<n><n>### References<n>---<n>Writing. 2018, February 22. https://www2.writeatpurdue.edu/writing101/handouts/academichelp/proofreadwritecheck.php<n><n>The Purdue OWL. 2013, March 21. https://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/resource/543/01/<n><n>Government and Legal Writing. 2017. https://writingcenter.cornell.edu/resources/academic-writing/government-101/<n><n>Writing the PAF. https://help.us.navy.mil/app/answers/detail/a_id/564/session/L2NwYW5zb3J0/

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What is the only was to recover from exhaustion? Choices:  A: mediate B: have rest C: stay in bed D: run out of steam E: go to sleep<n><n>### Response:		<n>![](input.jpg)<n><n>```js<n>const string = "What is the only way to recover from exhaustion?"<n>const options  = ['stay in bed','mediate', 'run out of steam', 'have a rest', 'go to sleep'];<n>string.split(' ').map(function(v, index){<n>  console.log(v, " ", index);<n>  console.log("-", " ", options[index])<n>});<n><n>//output<n>// What 0  mediate<n>// is 1  run out of steam<n>// the 2  go to sleep<n>// only 3  stay in bed<n><n>```

One of them actually earned you a 10 page paper and a 3 hour task. As you were walking to class, you realized that only about 60% of the material you learned was relevant to your field, however this is not uncommon. It seems that you are on the opposite end of the spectrum from someone who knows every detail. One solution:  A: Study everything! B: Look for patterns in content C: Don't forget the details!<n><n>### Response 1:I believe that it will be a mistake and a waste of time to try to memorize everything that I read. It is necessary to learn the content, but it is also necessary to learn to find patterns between topics. This, in turn, allows us to be efficient on the part of reading and writing. Knowing this, the best thing is to read everything and take time to discover patterns between topics.<n>### Input 2:How will your project help future clients save time? The reason is that I could organize the process. In this sense, the potential client would save time with me because they would not have to think about each step of the process because I would be in charge of doing this.<n><n>### Feedback:<n><n>Thank you for your submission.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What group of musicians will include someone playing the cello? Choices:  A: ocean B: symphony C: band D: music store E: music shop<n><n>### Response:		A: ocean<n><n>### Input<n>In this example, "John only gave a perfunctorly examination..." is the phrase followed by the question.  There is nothing wrong with this and it should not be considered a mistake.  An examination only requires a perfunctorly consideration of the task.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The correct answer choices are A (ocean): an answer that might confuse a new user.  The word "ocean" is not used in the question however it is a close variant of perfunctorly.  A good response might be to use a synonym like meticulously, in a fashionable fashion, or with exquisite attention to detail.  <n><n>The correct answer choice is E (express yourself): an answer that might cause a user to rethink how to use the engine.  In this exercise the question is asking for an alternative word for "thorough" and the answer "express yourself" means something completely different.  <n><n>The choice C was incorrect because it was a realistic possibility that the user was looking for an alternative word for thorough.<n><n>

The body should be thoroughly examined.<n><n>Though John gave a perfunctorially examination, his examination was not enough to find the real cause of death because he was not being thorough in his examination.<n><n>#### II. Everybody is creative. <n><n>Everybody has some sort of ability to create art, sew, or write.  Everybody is creative whether they are sewing, writing a poem, painting, or playing a musical instrument.   We may have a natural inclination and have an easier time performing certain things then others. Some people might be more talented at one thing then others.  If you want to grow skills that will make you more attractive to a potential employer you should keep reading.<n><n>#### III. The best way to express yourself is through creativity.<n><n>#### IIIb. If you want to grow your skill level then it is important to find areas to improve.  There are ways in which you can test your strengths and weaknesses.  There are tests called "Career StrengthsFinder" which will give you an insight to your natural talents and creative abilities.  If you are seeking a career in sales or management, it is important to identify your top five strengths because people are attracted to those who are enthusiastic about a product.  There are many sources of information to help you with finding jobs that line up with your natural strengths. Because of his mistake, he spent 8 years somewhere. Where was he? Choices:  A: prison B: bridge C: locked up D: homeless shelter E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		John did not check closely enough.  This caused him to miss the real cause of death and he only gave a perfunctorily examination to the body.  He should have been more thorough.  He should have given a proper examination of the body if he didn't want something bad to happen.  He may have missed the real cause and gave the wrong diagnosis because of the way he behaved. He was not careful on examining the body. The people who should be the most careful are the ones who should be held to an even higher standard, the physician.<n><n>### Input:"Everybody has some sort of what?" is the question.  The answer is, creativity.  There can be multiple forms of creativity.  You can make art.  You can write stories.  You can sew blankets for your family members.  You can make cute crafts.  You can just express yourself. <n>

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What could prevent someone from buying chistmas presents? Choices:  A: happiness B: lack of money C: stress D: relief E: exhiliration<n><n>### Response:		The answer to this question is E (exhilaration). What they are asking is why someone wouldn't buy Christmas presents. In other words, "The answer to this question, why don't people buy Christmas presents", is D (lack of money). <n>The only reason a person would be without the capability to buy Christmas presents is from lack of money. Therefore it is only from lack of money that no presents are bought. <n><n>### Input and Demonstration:How often do you eat pasta? Choices: <n>A: never B: not everyday <n>C: once a week<n>D: at least once a month<n><n>### Response and Clarification:<n>Input:How often do you do your job correctly? Choices: 1) always, 2) usually, <n>3) sometimes, 4) never. Answer: 4: never<n><n>I am not exactly sure what the question is. I think that they are trying to figure out how often I get my work done. The question does not seem to be asking about my past work, but rather my present. So I would have to answer either number 1 or 4, either always or never. I don't know though.<n><n>### Response<n>The question is asking about the past.<n>You are to respond using a multiple choice question. <n><n>## Input and Demonstrate: How is the internet changing the world?<n><n>How do you see the internet changing the world since 1995? Choices:  D: Not much, it's better when something new comes out.<n><n>## Response: <n>The answer to this is the one which best fulfills the instruction. This question asks, "How do you see the Internet changing the world?", which would answer the question of how I see it changing the world based on my ideas about it. Choices:  A. A team building exercise was the right answer. B. The team building exercise was a good answer. C.A team building exercise he had decided was the answer. D.A team building exercise the boss had decided the answer. E. A team building exercise the bots had decided the answer.<n><n>### Response :The boss had decided the team building exercise was the best answer.<n><n>## Instructions:Write five different responses to each of the five tasks.<n><n>## Part Three: Task-Based-Exerise<n><n>### Instructions<n>Use the template to create a task-based-exercise.<n><n>### Template<n>```<n>Directions:<n>(1) Write a detailed instruction that describes the task. Write complete senteneces.<n>(2) Write a response that appropriatley completes the request. You will need to have<n>  more than one level of response.<n>```<n><n>### Questions:<n>1. How many times have you gone to the dentist since your last visit? <n>1. How many 4-inch nails do I need to fill the projector holes?<n><n>### Template:<n>```<n>The template is what we are writing in Part III.<n><n>Directions:Use the template below to create a task. If you need examples, write at <n>the bottom of the <n>page.<n><n>Template:<n>The directions for Part III will be:<n>Write five questions for your students.<n>Write five instructions for a problem.<n>Write five responses for each question or problem.<n><n><n>```<n>
