Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n><n>### Response:		<n>You'd have to be pretty close to the stage at a concert.  I guess to be fair a concert could count as an event at a stock market...maybe the musician sells stocks...I mean it may be a stretch but technically what was happening on stage could count as a stock market event.<n><n>### Detailed response:<n>You'd also have to be pretty close up close to singers. There is an option for B, Concert, and you could possibly be up close to singers on stage. I think most people are far away and using the microphone. Not to sound like I am being snotty, but I don't care that they are singing at stage left versus stage right because I wouldn't care in any situation what side they are on.<n><n>Another thing is that I would have put a concert in that question, not tv studio because a concert could literally be one of several things, whereas a tv studio question is more precise. I'm just saying that a concert is more open ended than a tv studio, so why mention it in a concert questions?<n><n>The only other problem I do have is that a concert is not just live entertainment, but in most cases it is live entertainment and recorded in a recording studio. I wouldn't count a concert as a stock market event, because one might have to know something about stocks to consider it being a stock market event. I could consider it, as in maybe the band plays the same song every time they play the same concert, but i don't really consider that as a stock market event because I don't really consider the song being the same every time a concert, if that makes scense. I'm not trying to be a smart guy... I just wouldn't expect a concert to be a stock market event because you'd have to be a financial expert to consider it.<n><n><n><n><n>### Input/output:<n>Input: I am quite pleased with my new watch; its beating time is what I would call quite precise. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where are seats most likely bleachers? Choices:  A: movies B: opera C: theater D: lecture hall E: hockey game<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>``` ruby<n>def bleachers?<n>  case ARGV[0]<n>  when'movies'<n>    puts "Are movies being shown in large theaters or the outdoors?"<n>  when 'opera'<n>    puts "Is there an orchestra stage, pit, etc. or do opera singers stand by themselves, in front of others?"<n>  when 'theater'<n>    puts "Do you have seats or bleakeers in an unconvetional configuration where theater stages are not permanent?"<n>  when 'lecture hall'<n>    puts "Usually, you don't move these seats, do you?"<n>  when 'hockey game'<n>    puts "Does everyone have a seat, or are you standing? Is it indoors or outdoors?"<n>end<n>```<n>

C<n><n>```py<n><n>    def is_correct (word:Dict[str, int]):<n>        answer = " "<n>        for c in word:<n>                answer = c + answer<n>        return answer<n>  <n>    def answer_question(answer:str):<n>        def is_right(word:int, answer:str):<n>            print(f'Input: {answer}')<n>            print(f'\t\t\tAnswer:{is_correct(word)}')<n>        input('Input:'+ answer + '\tEnter\t\t\t\twant to learn more (A) ')<n>        input('Answer: ')    <n>        if answer[1][0] == 'A':<n>            is_right(input(), answer)<n><n>    is_correct = {1:12, <n>                  2:3,<n>                  3:2,<n>                  4:4,<n>                  5:5,<n>                  6:6,<n>                  7:7,<n>                  8:8,<n>                  9:9,<n>                  10:10,<n>                  11:11,<n>                  12:12}<n><n>    answer_question(input())<n><n>20.<n> 40:Input:

Choices:  A: feeble B: bullbleep C: cow D: female E: charging prey<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. C<n>2. A<n>3. A<n><n>### Demands:<n>1. C - Avoid ambiguous or confusing words<n>2. A - Avoid using personal pronouns such as “I” or “my”<n>3. A – Avoid using emotionally loaded words<n>4. A – Avoid idioms and other expressions whose meanings are not evident from the sentence written immediately before them<n>5. A – Avoid saying that something “can’t” or “can’t be” done, unless you’re asking for confirmation of the impossibility<n><n>### Inputs:<n>1. Choices:   A: type of hair B: talent C: creativity D: color<n><n>**Examples of ambiguous words:**<n>1. A. "The report was complete." *Does your boss want a report that has a fancy cover? Was it fully written up and finished? Or did he want to see a report that's finished and thorough.*<n>2. B. "The report was thorough." *He wants to see a report that was all completed (the work), but also a report that checked out everything thoroughly (it wasn't rushed at all).*<n><n>**Examples for word choice:**<n>1. C. "His report was feeble." *You don't want to say it's "weak," even though "feeble" means the same thing. The word "weak" could refer to his ability to do the job, so he might take your comment personally.*<n>2. E. "You create ideas!" *I like this one because it sounds a bit more formal than the other possibilities.*<n>3. A. "Her performance was excellent." *This isn't as easy as it seems. She didn't perform some action just once - her whole performance was excellent, and that means she did a wonderful job.*<n><n>### Explanation:<n>1. A. “They want you to complete your report as thoroughly as possible, so put all the required sections and elements in your report, and don’t skip over any part.”<n>2. B. “They want you make

Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Food must be freeze dried before it is taken on what vehicle? Choices:  A: fairgrounds B: friend's house C: space shuttle D: oven E: microwave<n><n>### Response:		F<n><n>### Input B:<n><n>We now need the vehicle that can transport the food, the what? Choices: A: rocket B: fairgrounds rover C: space shuttles D: submarine E: school bus.<n>Answer: A: rocket<n><n>### Input C:<n><n><n><n>### Input D:<n><n>A long, long ways away.  It's the final frontier.  It's what? Choices:A: the world B: the other half of life C: outer space D: the stars E: our home<n>Answer: A: the world<n><n>### Input E:<n><n>In the case of a nuclear war, the population who are most likely to survive are the who? Choices: A) people with pets B) people who can speak foreign languages C) people who can speak Korean D) people with military expertise E) people who have a sense of humor<n><n>Answer: E: People who have a sense of humour.<n><n>### Input A:<n><n>You were not at your best tonight. Your performance was which of the following? Choices:A) adequate B) terrible C) magnificient D) adequate E) subpar F) dismal<n><n>Answer: E : subpar or low quality.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>My performance was what you said tonight. It was subpar, low-quality. Adequate, terrible, magnificain, adequate, and dismal were all wrong and very offensive. I'm very offended.<n><n>### Conclusion<n><n>I hope you have a good life.<n>

This corporation is not only a large government entity, it is also a major player in defense. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:A bride and groom are taking care of proposals, what is the likely ceremony? Choices:  A: efficiency B: getting work done C: marriage D: finishing up E: results<n><n>### Response:		<n>The likely ceremony is efficiency.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>This statement is talking about the ceremony that happens every so often, which are efficiency.<n><n>## Reflections<n><n>### Challenge<n><n>The instruction in Part A is clear.<n><n>The challenge in Part B was keeping track of where the word was used previously, and finding it in the body of the text, not the glossary. <n><n><n>### Solutions and Examples<n><n>**Part A**<n>* **input**: <n>  * The instruction tells us that we are going to be required to write and instruction.<n>  * The instruction is going to be about something that was done poorly and we are going to tell what it was about how it is going to be done better.<n>  * The input tells us to say something and it also tells us that the task is going to be about a corpse.<n><n>* **output**: <n> <n>* **response**: <n>  This is an instruction that requests that we write a response that appropriately corrects the instruction.<n><n>* **demonstration**: <n>  Since an instruction is not yet given on how to demonstrate, we are suppose to use these words to make an instruction.<n>### Reflection<n><n>This was an interesting challenge from both sides. On one side, I had to make a response for the output, which was different then I have ever had to do. It was easy to get lost of track of what the instructions were because a lot of things were included with the two parts. I wish there would have been more clarification into the glossary so I knew which word to use to say what. However, I do not blame the maker because the challenge is just meant to be a challenge, not make easy.<n><n>## Revision<n><n>I believe that the instruction given for the challenge was clear to some, but not all. I also think it was not clear that the output would be about the word that was given, instead of what the entire sentence meant. I wish it was more specific as to what word we were suppose to use for the "work" it was talking about. I believe I should have used a different word in my demonstration.<n>

A: Highlight B: Beneath C: Below D: Lower E: Read<n>3. ____________ is in good physical condition. Choices: . A: Health B: Fit C: Sick D: Well E: Infected<n>4. _______________ comes in two flavors, strawberry and blueberry. Choices:  A. Milk B. Ice cream C. Cake D. Donut<n>5. Please note the difference and use correct spelling between 'loose' and 'lose'.  Choices:  A 'Lose' means to give someone.  'Loose' is the adjective for, 'Not tight'.<n><n>### Response options:<n><n>1. Mark the correct option in every pair or group (Noun or Adjective, Yes or No, Correct usage or Incorrect usage).<n>2. He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:There aren't many anemone in what glove-shaped state? Choices:  A: michigan B: lake C: tide pool D: nursery E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		B: lake<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that accurately completes the request, using the information below.<n><n>### Information:<n>Whenever a murder is committed, it's the detective's job to determine what kind of murder it is. There is only one type of murder known to law enforcement: Murder the Fourth. This type of murder is defined by the Murderer's Code of what year?<n><n>### Demand:<n>In one paragraph, describe what the murder was.<n><n>### Answer:<n>Murder the Fourth is a murder that occurs when the murderer's first three choices of murder go awry, and he/she is left only with Fourth Choice.<n><n>### Reference:<n>[Murder the Fourt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_the_Fourth)

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:The investigator considered the gun evidence, where did he send it? Choices:  A: drawer B: back to its owner C: police station D: crime scene E: holster<n><n>### Response:		<n><code><n>var prompts = [<n>    {<n>        "question": "Because you are more than just a machine.",<n>        "answer": "A: clever machine B: machine that learns C: machine that behaves D: smart machine E: intelligent machine"<n>    },<n>    {<n>        question: "What was the question?",<n>        answer: "B",<n>    },<n>    {"question": "Because it is not the answer, but the correct answer.", "answer": "C"}<n>];<n><n><n>const promptsIterator = prompts.keys().reduce((promptsArray, key) => {<n>    promptsArray.push(prompts[key]);<n>    return promptsArray;<n>}, []);<n>prompt(promptsIterator[0]); // question<n>prompt(prompt[2].answer); // answer<n>answer();<n>`<n><n>### Instructions<n>There are three numbers. The product of the first two equals 27.<n>The sum of the first and second numners is less than 200.<n>The first number is two more than the second number.<n><n>### Answer(s)<n>If you need one sentence, one can replace with two:<n>`The first number is two greater than the second`<n>Or a full sentence:<n>`The first two numbers have a product of 27, and the sum of them is less than 27. The first number is a greater than the second number, since the second number is two less than the first.`<n><n>### Input<n>The input is three numbers.<n><n>### Output (response)<n>The output is three numbers.<n>

Grammatical and sentence errors can quickly detract from a writers intent, reducing the quality of the work. When a writer displays these errors, it can weaken or destroy their work.<n><n>If the instructions are unclear, ask your mentor or tutor. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Danny hated helping people.  It always brought what? Choices:  A: satisfaction B: good feelings C: complications D: feel good about yourself E: stress<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>We've been working with questions recently where the input has been a title that requires a response to be appropriate under the title.  It's been going very well and it's one of the main things we're working on at the moment and has been the case for the entire session.  If we try and write a question where the input is a sentence, that has a title, I think it's a little bit of a stretch.  It's not completely impossible and, perhaps, it can be done.  I don't think there's anything wrong with an attempt, per se; however, trying to build a response to a question that looks a bit more like the first instruction seems a little bit of a better option.<n><n><n>It can't be that hard to write a response to a question where the input isn't even a title but a sentence.  The instructions describe something and there's a question that follows.  There are options and those options are all answers that follow the question.  It's a fairly easy, straightforward thing to write a response.  The only thing that's required is that the response be appropriate.  It needs to be appropriate to the question, appropriate to the instruction, appropriate to the context of a conversation that we're attempting to build in here with an automated system.<n><n>An appropriate response to this instruction is going to require that the response is "thorough".  The only really problematic choice is the one that describes a response as "intricate".  "Intricate" is not a word that we've used since we established that we were working with vocabulary.  Anybody can look up any dictionary and see as much.  Now we have dictionaries. <n><n>We've looked up a bunch and all of them say the same thing.  It's too bad that an automated system doesn't always work the way we need it to.  All you can do really, is establish what you need and not much more.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What is something you do  in a bank? Choices:  A: make noise B: have tea C: make time D: make payments E: take time<n><n>### Response:		<n>Make payments<n><n><n>### Input :What are you going to do today?<n><n><n>Choices:  A: go to work on time  B: work on time C: go home early today D: take a nap <n><n>### Response :<n>B and D<n><n>This is an example of a task instruction.  You might not complete the sentence that is instructing you.  A common pattern is to complete the sentence with "Choose either X or Y, X or Y, or X, Y and Z" or some other phrase.  If you are stuck, think carefully about the first "choice" first.  The second "choice" second, third, fourth, etc. are likely to be synonyms.  So don't get frustrated.<n><n>There is good reason for using "choose one".  The first choice narrows the list of acceptable options. The second and third choice are synonyms.  Sometimes people use just one word.  But when they do be aware that there is more than one way to interpret that first word.  So, the choice instruction should tell you what to choose to avoid error.  What is an acceptable choice should be explained and the expected results be given.  A good example would be: <n><n>**Choose one**:  [a] I will [b] I am going to [c] The train is coming <n><n>[a] is an acceptable answer  but is not the question.  [b] and [c] are acceptable answers but indicate that the first element of the task was not completed (The train is coming). <n><n>Choose one is not always the best way to instruct an answer.  This instruction can be overly limiting because choices  are not always the same.  Another good choice might be:<n><n>**Write an answer**   **that is either [a] this or [b] the other** <n><n>[b] is often not the same as, [a].<n>As a final check, the responses can also be used to check if an appropriate response was given.  Be careful with these though, you might accidentally find out the right answer.<n><n>### Test:<n><n>**Choose two**: [a] [b]<n><n>**Write an explanation** that explains how and why you came to the conclusion you did.  Also tell who or what made this choice easier

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:He waited for his friend at the squash court, but he was worried his friend thought he meant the at the other end of the public what? Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n><n>### Response:		<n>To complete this request, you need to:<n>- Define a rule to handle "He waited for his friend..."<n>- Use the definition you created<n>- Apply the definition to the given text<n>- Use the result of the match to answer the question<n><n>You need to apply the new rule to the given text to make sure it matches the correct rule. In the first example, you need to apply the definition to the given input "He waited for his friends at the squash court" by matching the input to the definition with the best match in the definition (country club if you were correct with the definition of rich person's house). You then check the match score with the definition to know if you got it right. The question "What is the best way to create idea?" asks you to answer with  "Express yourself" as the definition suggests that you'll create an idea by yourself.<n><n>To define a rule, you've to write a dictionary with a key and a match function. The key of the dictionary must respect the structure of the match function and the match function will only be used in the match function of the dictionary.<n><n>### Matching<n>To match you need the following:<n>1. Key: a group of tokens inside a function.<n>2. Match Function: It takes a string and return a dictionary.<n><n>**Example:** <n>```python<n># This is a dict with a key and a matching function<n>def match(key, match_function, match_dict):<n>    try:<n>        r = match_function(key)<n>        match_dict[key] = r<n>        return match_dict<n>    except:<n>        return None<n><n># This is the rule definition<n>rules = {<n>    # A dict containing the keys and the match function<n>    'key': r # key, rule = {...},<n>    #...<n>    'key' : 'He waited for his friend...'<n>}<n>```<n>The dictionary `rules` has a `key` with the keyword `He waited for his friend`. <n>The function `match` takes a string as input and will match the string to the `key`. In this example, the function `match` matches the string `He waited for his fri...` to the `key`. If the function return `True`, it means there is a match and we create a match dictionary.<n><n>## 1. The key should only

We need to stop and realize that the other person is also a victim, or we can be the same. But, you can start with any coding language and transition your way into Javascript.<n><n>### When making your new directory, include the following naming for your code:<n><n>`newfilename.js` <n><n>```javascript<n>export default class Exercise110213 {<n>    // write your code here    //<n>}<n>``` <n><n>### Notice:<n><n>The `export default class` portion of is JavaScript code.  It signifies the entry point for your code-module (what you create).  This is the function that is run by the `newfilename.js`.  At some point early in your project, you will probably want to change how the `export default` function, and the `newfilename.j` are associated.  <n><n>### In many coding environments the last line in `newfilename.js` must be returned. This is to return a value (and there are usually multiple) to the user. <n><n>### You should test your

It may be true that everybody has something of creativity, but not everyone expresses it.  The turkey was placed in a fridge, as it doesn't spoil in the heat.<n><n>### Input<n><n>"The man in the street" refers to average person or normal citizen. <n><n>### Response<n><n>The man on the street would never spend money on a product that he doesn't know exactly what it is or how it works.  Some street food is only sold when it's made available, but it's always delicious.<n><n>### Note: It is acceptable to add punctuation, such as commas, semicolons, and periods to appropriately format your response to make it easier to read.<n><n>### Output<n><n>    I'm looking for someone who uses a strong method  to deal with problems.  The job needs to be finished, but not rushed.  I'd like someone who is not afraid to follow orders and do what's required.  Also, I'm looking for person who can express ideas clearly.<n>    I have one rule for this job.  It must be completed.  There are some conditions, the most important is to complete the job.  After finishing this job be rewarded a big amount of money.<n>    The man in the street might or might not want to see what he's buying before buying.  If he knows what it is, he'll be more likely to buy it.  The man in the street would like street food sellers to sell their food.<n>    On average every guy on the street is not willing to put their life in danger to complete this job.<n>* What is the purpose of the prompt?<n><n>Answer: To find someone who has a lot of _______ in life to talk to an _____. <n><n>* What are the instructions?<n><n>The instructions are to take an _______.<n><n>* What information do I need and what information does a prompt give me?<n><n>The prompt will give me information about the speaker and the information I need is what personality traits the speaker has.<n><n>* What is the difference between a hint and a prompt?<n><n>A prompt is someone who is looking for a certain thing in a person

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a bass clarinet to take home? Choices:  A: orchestra B: school band C: music store D: opera house E: home<n><n>### Response:		<n>You do not know the answer to this question, but it is your intuition that you have been to see a symphony orchestra, school band, and perhaps also a music store.  If you need more information, the other responders may be able to provide it.<n><n>### Input<n><n>It turns out there are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy.  - Hamlet, Act I, Scene V<n><n>### Response<n>Another reference to heaven implies that Shakespeare was familiar with Christian doctrine.  Given the context, however, the quote refers to other worlds than the Christian heaven and hell.  It is unclear what else Hamlet's words refer to, but he appears shocked about them, and their mention is so abrupt that it makes one wonder how the rest of the conversation would have gone.  Hamlet would have been a most uninteresting character if he merely expressed his acceptance of the unknowability of things.<n><n>### Comments:<n>Shakespeare's use of this quote is so enigmatic that it leaves much to the imagination and a mystery in the story (what other worlds exist?).<n><n>### Instrument:<n>While Hamlet, who has been a student at Wittenberg University, appears to speak in the Elizabethan English of the play, his actual comments appear to be entirely ungrammatical sentences.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What happens when someone is playing too aggressively? Choices:  A: get hungry B: laughter C: injury D: having fun E: feeling happy<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Solution 1<n><n>```python<n>from collections import counter<n>input = "Everybody has some sort of what?"<n>choice_list = ["create art", "write", "sew", "create idea", "express yourself"]<n>answer_list = ["B", "C", "E", "D", "A"]<n><n>choice_counter = counter(choice_list)<n><n>for correct_answer, incorrect_answers in zip(choice_counter.most_common(), choice_list):<n>    print(choice_counter.count(correct_answer))<n>    print(correct_answer, " occurs ", choice_counter.count( incorrect_answers), " times.".format(**locals()))<n>```<n>### Solution 2<n>```python<n>from random import shuffle<n>from copy import deepcopy<n>input = "Every body has some sort of creatity,it is the best way to express yourself."<n>choice_list = ['create art','write','sew', 'create ideal', 'express yourself']<n>answer_list = [0,1,2,3,4]<n>arr = deepcopy(choice_list)  <n><n>shuffle(arr)  <n>for i in range(len(choice_list)):<n>    print(choice, " occurs ", counter.most_common(arr)[1][1]).format(**locals())<n>    time.sleep(3)<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where might a yard be tiny? Choices:  A: farmland B: neighborhood C: city D: property E: subdivision<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Justification:<n>- Answer must be D: property (yard not used that much)<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:Answer all four short answer questions.<n><n>**A:**  John did nothing more than perfunctorily examine the corpse, even though he correctly performed all of his tasks.  Had he been more cautious, he would have uncovered the true cause of death.<n><n>**B:**  Any person, including John, has artistic skills and expressive abilities.<n><n>**C:** The yard in the short story was too small for the man to run.<n><n>**D:**  John must have made a poor, inaccurate observation of the yard because it was tiny.<n><n>**A**:  John did nothing more and just perfunctorily examined the corpse, though, he accurately did all his tasks. If he had been more thoughtful, he would have discovered the real reason of death.<n><n><n>![](/public/img/pulp-gore/A01.png)<n><n>**B**:  Anyone of all ages, regardless of gender or creativity level, can create art or a concept.<n><n>**C**: John's yard is smaller than a yard normally would be. Consequently, John's yard did not provide space for him to run.<n><n>The main concept in the story is that John is a careless man, thus the yard is tiny.<n><n>![](/public /img/pulp- gore/B01.png) ![](/public/img/ pulp-gore/B02.jpg "B02")<n><n>**C: John's yard was too small to run in.<n><n>D: John had a poor observation of the yard because his yard was too small.**<n><n>**C** The idea the author was trying to get across to the reader in the text was that John was a careless man. It wasn't intended to be a metaphor about the man's yard.<n><n>**A **I believe that this short story was written by a woman because the perspective from which the story is told is from a young woman.<n><n>![](/ public/img/pulp gore/C01.jpg)<n><n>

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:The shore was now a tourist attraction with nearby little shops, but at one time this what was home to a bustling fishing industry? Choices:  A: seaside town B: resort C: ocean D: california E: beach<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input<n>The shore was now a tranquil place, a seaside town, it had lost most of it's former residents.<n><n>### Reponse<n>A seaside town.<n><n>### Output <n>The shore was now home to a busting fishing industry.<n><n>### Input <n>Jane didn't appreciate the art that came into her life, she only appreciated what was what? Choices: A: unique B: old C: foreign D: free E: ordinary<n><n>### Repsonse<n>Jane didn' t appreciate the new art that came into her new home.<n><n>### Task<n>Describe a place or thing that has changed over time. Use two details to explain why it changed. Explain where it is now..<n><n>### What is this task and purpose?  It is asking an individual to choose a place and explain how it changed.<n><n>### Tips<n>Tips<n><n>### Instructions<n>* Write the task<n>* Write the description of the task<n>    * It tells you what is required<n>    * It may be in the form of an instruction<n>* Give the demonstration<n>    * It demonstrates how to do it.  it may be an example<n>    * It may demonstrate how to describe a place or thing<n>    * It may show the task itself<n>* Give the input<n>    * It may contain the question<n>    * It may use synonyms<n>    * It may ask a question<n>    * It maybe a multiple choice question <n>    * It may have choices<n>    * It may not have choices <n>    * It maybe an instruction<n>    * It is the task<n>    *  It may not have a topic<n>* Give the response<n>    * It may answer the task <n>    * It answers the question<n>    * There isn’t any questions<n>    * It may give the task again<n>    * It may say “I am _____”<n>    * There isn't instructions<n>    * It may only be instruction<n>* Give the input response<n>    * It is what you get from the input <n>    * It gives you the response<n>* Give the output<n>    * It gives the response <n>    * It is from the input<n>    * You get it from the input<n>   <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:The shelf was showing signs of instability, what should the carpenter fix to avoid any issues? Choices:  A: roof B: corner C: school building D: wall E: cupboard<n><n>### Response:		C: school building<n><n>### Instructions: Write a response that correctly completes each of the following sentences.<n><n>### Input :  The doctor gave the man a checkup so he could find out what was wrong with his body.<n>**Input :  The doctor gave him a checkup to know what was wrong with his health.**<n><n>### Input  : This examination can only reveal what is visible.<n>**Input : This examination can show what is visible.**<n><n>## Output<n><n>```Output:  "The teacher taught his students about the science of energy."<n><n>Output:  "The nurse examined the doctor."```<n><n>## Solution<n><n>This function can be solve using Regex. Input = regex.Match(`(.*)`).Groups[1] and Regex.Matches(`(.*)`) will return Group index for the first capturing group in input string and return the string from the second group index of input string.<n><n><n>```csharp<n>private void RegExFunction()<n>{<n>     Console.WriteLine($"The doctor gave the patient a checkup to find out what was wrong, which wasn't what was wrong with his stomach. He thought a good way to do it, was to check his bones!");<n><n>     var testData = new List<string><n>     {<n>         "the doctor examined the patient for cancer.",<n>         "the doctor gave the man a thorough checkup",<n>         "the nurse examined the patient in the operating room",<n>         "the teacher taught his students about nuclear energy",<n>         "the doctor prescribed pain medication for the man."<n>     };<n><n>     foreach (var data in testData)<n>     {<n>         string[] wordsAndCombinations = Regex.Split(data, @"\s*,\s*(.|\n)*\s*\.")<n>               .Select(Group => string.Join(" ", Group))<n>               .ToArray();<n><n>         foreach (string group in wordsAndCombinations)<n>         {<n>             Console.WriteLine($"{group} was {Group.Length} characters long.");<n>         }<n>     }<n>}<n>```

Vocabulary words are found in the work, and must be in italics or underlined.<n><n>-The answer must use proper capitalization in the beginning of a sentence, as well as punctuation properly placed.<n><n>### Response Rubric:<n>-The response is between 1-2 pages in length.<n><n>-The vocabulary words used are correct and in the proper place in the sentences or questions.<n><n>-The paragraph's structure in terms of sentences, capitalization, and organization are correct and clear.<n><n>-The grammar is correct.<n><n>-The paper contains no grammatical or spelling errors.<n><n>-You clearly demonstrated that you understand what is required and the proper response to the instructions.<n><n>-You thoroughly understand what is required.<n><n><n><n>### Response Guidelines (In-Depth):<n>-The response should include two complete well-written paragraphs of 2-3 sentences each.<n><n>-The responses must include at least two pieces of new vocabulary words, including proper capitalization and usage.<n><n>-The sentences need to be varied in length, structure, and form, using transitions where appropriate.<n><n>### In-Depth Response Rubric:<n><n>-The response is of high quality (5 points).<n><n>-The response includes at least two well-written paragraphs, complete sentences, and correct grammar.<n><n>-The writing demonstrates an excellent grasp and understanding of the content of the response.<n><n>-The student demonstrates a strong ability to think critically about the material and to write about it in an organized and cogent manner.<n><n>-The research or evidence support the student's opinions on the content of the response, as well as provide a range of evidence and reasoning to support the answers.<n><n>-The language is clear, correct, and precise.<n><n>-The answers and opinions on the content are concise but complete.<n><n>-All questions are answered.<n><n>

It's really short for "tis' is".<n><n>### Response b: "'Tis is a contractions for "It is".    "Ah, there'd be no better news". "Ah, there' is good news".  "Ah, there are better news"  "Tis news is better.  "Aha, there's no worse news"  "Ah, there is news you're no longer in danger"  So, "tis I" means there is some news.<n><n>### Input"I'm no stranger to deja vu, but today..."  "I got to thinking..." In this situation, 'what?' describes 'the situation' and 'for it?' describes'something that happens.<n>2. A 'favor' could be a favor done in a formal or informal manner, for example:<n>    * 'Can I ask you a favor?' means 'can you do something for me?' <n>    * 'We had to do favors for everybody at the party.' means 'we were asked to do something for most people at the party.'<n><n><n>

(Answer: the pond)<n>    - What tense did the sentence use? (Answer: Present)<n>    - What is an adverb in the sentence? (Answer The water in the pond was cold.)<n>    - What is a noun in the sentence? ( Answer: cat)<n>    - Name the letter sounds that begin with each of the following letters: I (ah/ee), N (en/on), V (eh-v)<n>    - Which one of the following words has a silent e at the end? (Answer: weight)<n>    - What do you find when you look up the letter c in a dictionary? (Answer: the letter c written in the dictionary)<n>    - When you turn, like a ballerina, with your right shoulder, which foot does your left hand cross under?<n><n>### Output:<n>- At least 10 multiple choice problems.<n>- Student scores and answers in a format that can be easily imported into your gradebook or learning management system.<n>### Output should look like this (informal example; input/response not required):<n>```<n>Sample output 1<n>==================<n><n>Input: My teacher told us to study for Monday's exam and do good work on the next test.<n>Answer: "Do" is a verb<n><n>Input: "We're going to the beach tomorrow!"<n>Answer: "Tomorrow" is an adverb, "going" is a verb, "beach" is a noun<n><n>Input: Look at the colorful dresses.<n>Answer: "Dresses" is a noun, "colorful" is an adjective<n>```<n><n>### Rationale:<n>- Multiple Choice gives students the opportunity to exercise critical thinking, reading and analysis skills.<n>- If you have students fill this out, you have an indication of what they know (or don't know) about the words and concepts.<n><n>## Submit:<n>-

It was good weather, and she wanted to make sure the garden was working properly.  The neighbors were away, and her son was only home for the weekend.  She decided to walk the dogs.  They were getting older, after all, and it was getting more difficult.  She was glad to have them now because they always made her feel safe.  Walking them was also a chance to clear her head.  She knew her daughter was worried about her, but she wanted to do everything she could for herself.  Her health had been a constant battle, and she would not let on to anyone how hard it was.  She started walking after dinner because it was cooler out in the evening.  The dogs kept her company and made her feel like she always was someone's babysitter.  She decided to take a different path than normal this time, because she felt she needed something different.  She had always walked in the same direction, and she knew it was time to explore more of the park and the city.  It was all part of her decision process to find something a little more fulfilling.  She walked for a few hours, as usual, but this time she wasn't as careful about when the walk started.  She was just beginning to enjoy herself when she tripped on the rocks near the water. Luckily, she was able to right herself, and her dogs just wagged their tails and started walking again.  She felt her heart start to pound, but she was sure she was okay.  Her only concern at the moment was that it was getting dark.

Choices:  A: tennessee B: band practice C: orchestra D: violin case E: music store<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple choice question: The answer is A: tennessee. The explanation that follows explains why. A tenor saxophone is a saxophone with which? Choices:  B: metal C: a range of over three octaves D: a range of between middle c to middle ab E: a range of a fourth below soprano saxophone<n>### Response: A tenor sax is a sax that, has a range of over three(3) octaves, that being from c4 to c or c4 to bb1. A baritone sax is just the same save for being an octave below instead of high, so its range from b4 all the way to bb. A soprano sax the same way only an octave is a higher low compared to high and low and also a alto is an octave more or less a 3rd lower than tenor. A sax with a range of c4 to c or b4 to cb1 is a saxophonist of any size except perhaps a bass clarinetist.<n><n>### Input- <n>If someone is born with a congenital ailment (ie they were born with something wrong with them, like cystic fibrosis), what is it called when an injury, not an ailment, is acquired after birth? <n><n>### Response<n>The response should start with "The correct answer is B, because....", and then use text and a link to demonstrate that the answer is B. The text should be 3-4 sentences and link to a site, page, video, or audio that provides evidence. <n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-selection questions.<n><n>### Task:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions. <n><n>## Solution:<n><n>### Instuction:<n><n>- (15 Minutes) You are responsible for updating the company’s website (www.testflight.com) using HTML and CSS.<n>- (10 Minutes) Your task is to:<n><n>1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:People always talked childlike to him, even though his disability was physical and didn't affect his what? Choices:  A: strength B: brain C: potential D: qualification E: competence<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>var resObj = null;<n><n>if (objType == 'Demand') {<n>    resObj = obj[0];<n>    taskName = obj[1];<n>    taskType = obj[2];<n>    <n>} else {<n>    if (objType == 'SentenceCompletion') {<n>       resOpt = obj[0];        <n>       taskType = obj[1];      <n>       taskName = obj[2];          <n>    }<n>}<n><n>var output ='';<n><n>switch (taskName) {<n>    case 'careful':<n>        output = 'A');<n>        break;<n><n>    case 'thoughtful':<n>        output= 'B');<n>        break;    <n><n>    case 'complete':<n>       output = 'C');<n>        break;        <n>    case 'thorough':<n>       output= 'D');<n>        break; <n>    case 'express yourself':<n>       output= E);<n>        break;<n>    case 'create a work of art':<n>       output= A);<n>        break;                <n>    case 'creativity':<n>      output ='A');<n>	   break;<n>}<n>console.log(output)<n>```<n>

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:How often are secular parties held? Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The answer is A. It says that secular parties are not held too often, <n><n>but rather they are held occasionally. The main point of the paragraph is to say how secular parties are held, which is not often. It mentions that sometimes a group of people gather to attend but not often.<n><n>The answer is E. It says that everyone or the majority of people attending are creative, but creativity can not be limited to art or a writing. Creativity is about expressing ourselves. It does not mean to express in a certain way, but to express yourself in a way.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:We want to try some new barbecue sauces, where should we buy some? Choices:  A: detroit B: australia C: michigan park D: cafe E: retail store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Complete the task described below.<n><n>### Description:<n>This task requires you to follow the directions and instructions, as well as to demonstrate certain capabilities you are not expected to have, such as the ability to work with the operating system of a particular mobile device. You must be aware of those capabilities. A good instruction asks you to do a simple task that requires you to identify and select certain items that you may have used before. It would look like this: Select a ___, then ___, then ___.<n><n>### Sample Tasks:<n>The task could be to choose from a list of applications, then do something with them, or choose and then use different kinds of widgets. The task should also help you understand the capabilities of the devices.<n><n>### Writing the Task:<n>To write the task, you must define exactly what users have to do, as well as the resources and capabilities the users need, to complete the task.<n><n>To do that, follow these guidelines:<n><n>1. **Provide a description of what the user(s) do(es), or has or have to do.** If the task has more than one part, describe each separately.<n>2. **Provide the name of a user interface feature** or a user action and, if necessary, its parameters or properties.<n>3. **Provide instructions on how the users can do it, including each step of the task.** Use appropriate labels, such as buttons, when appropriate. You may include links to external sites provided your users have the appropriate capabilities to support them.<n>4. **Define resource requirements that are sufficient to complete the task.** You may need to give a general guideline, for example, that the user has to have a camera on his smartphone. The user must also have all the other features of the device necessary to do the task.<n>5. **Include optional steps for completing the task.**<n>    Provide information that can help complete and clarify the task, without being confusing or difficult or adding unnecessary steps that would make the task more complex. If you specify multiple options, clarify which is the preferred option. For example: to buy a product at www.example.com, click here or download to device.<n><n>### Incorrect Tasks:<n>Do not write instructions for the user that require the user to do one of the following:<n>

Choices:  A: tenacity B: hands C: coaster D: skill E: breaking<n><n>### Response:		The man set the mug on the coffee table without a cup coaster available.  Without hands able to properly balance the cup he is left with a cup that is in danger of tipping.  He doesn't have the hand strength, skill, or tenacity to keep it balanced.<n><n>### Input<n>```{dropdown}<n>	<label class="inline-block ml-none">Hey</label><n>	<a id="question-response" class="btn btn-success">Questions!</a><n>```<n><n>### Response<n><n>```py<n>import discord<n>import requests<n>import json<n><n># 1.
